title: Interface to USAspending.gov API
Interface to USAspending.gov API
text: can install development version usaspending GitHub :

title: Agency Federal Accounts — agency_federal_account
text: Functions retrieve federal account information agencies, including account details, counts, associated treasury accounts.

title: Agency Federal Accounts — agency_federal_account
code: agency_federal_account(   toptier_code,   fiscal_year = NULL,   .page_all = FALSE,   ... )  agency_federal_account_count(toptier_code, fiscal_year = NULL, ...)

title: Agency Federal Accounts — agency_federal_account
text: toptier_code character string containing 3-4 digit numeric code uniquely identifies top-tier federal agency (e.g., "086" Department Housing Urban Development). Must valid CGAC (Common Government-wide Accounting Classification) FREC (Federal Record Classification) code. fiscal_year Optional numeric value specifying fiscal year query. NULL (default), API use current fiscal year. Must 2017 later. .page_all Logical indicating whether retrieve pages results (TRUE) just first page (FALSE, default). TRUE, function automatically handle pagination retrieve complete dataset. ... Additional parameters passed specific API endpoints. Common options include: page: Integer specifying page number retrieve (default: 1) limit: Integer specifying number records per page (default: 10) sort: Field sort results (varies endpoint) order: Sort direction: "asc" "desc" (default varies endpoint)

title: Agency Federal Accounts — agency_federal_account
text: function returns tibble different structures: agency_federal_account() returns: code: Federal account code name: Account name total_budgetary_resources: Total resources obligated_amount: Amount obligated gross_outlay_amount: Gross outlay amount children: Nested data frame treasury account details agency_federal_account_count() returns: toptier_code: Agency identifier code fiscal_year: Fiscal year federal_account_count: Number federal accounts treasury_account_count: Number treasury accounts

title: Agency Federal Accounts — agency_federal_account
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Get federal accounts for HUD fed_accounts <- agency_federal_account("086",                                        fiscal_year = 2023,                                       .page_all = TRUE)  # Get account counts account_counts <- agency_federal_account_count("086", fiscal_year = 2023) }

title: Agency Awards Information — agency_awards
text: Functions retrieve award information federal agencies, including counts, transaction data, new award metrics.

title: Agency Awards Information — agency_awards
code: agency_awards(toptier_code, fiscal_year = NULL, .page_all = FALSE, ...)  agency_awards_count(toptier_code, fiscal_year = NULL, ...)  agency_awards_count_all(fiscal_year = NULL, .page_all = FALSE, ...)

title: Agency Awards Information — agency_awards
text: toptier_code character string containing 3-4 digit numeric code uniquely identifies top-tier federal agency (e.g., "086" Department Housing Urban Development). Must valid CGAC (Common Government-wide Accounting Classification) FREC (Federal Record Classification) code. fiscal_year Optional numeric value specifying fiscal year query. NULL (default), API use current fiscal year. Must 2017 later. .page_all Logical indicating whether retrieve pages results (TRUE) just first page (FALSE, default). TRUE, function automatically handle pagination retrieve complete dataset. ... Additional parameters passed specific API endpoints. Common options include: page: Integer specifying page number retrieve (default: 1) limit: Integer specifying number records per page (default: 10) sort: Field sort results (varies endpoint) order: Sort direction: "asc" "desc" (default varies endpoint)

title: Agency Awards Information — agency_awards
text: function returns tibble different structures: agency_awards() returns: toptier_code: Agency identifier code fiscal_year: Fiscal year awards latest_action_date: Date recent award action transaction_count: Number award transactions obligations: Total award obligations amount agency_awards_count() returns: toptier_code: Agency identifier code fiscal_year: Fiscal year requested new_award_count: Count new awards period agency_awards_count_all() returns: page_metadata: Pagination information results: List agencies award counts type

title: Agency Awards Information — agency_awards
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Get 2023 awards for HUD with all pages hud_awards <- agency_awards("086",                             fiscal_year = 2023,                            .page_all = TRUE)                             # Get award counts for HUD in fiscal year 2023 award_counts <- agency_awards_count("086", fiscal_year = 2023)  # Get award counts across all agencies all_counts <- agency_awards_count_all(fiscal_year = 2023) }

what: Agency Budget Functions and Resources — agency_budget_function_count
title: Agency Budget Functions and Resources — agency_budget_function_count
text: Functions retrieve budget-related information federal agencies, including budget functions, budgetary resources, obligations award category.

title: Agency Budget Functions and Resources — agency_budget_function_count
code: agency_budget_function_count(toptier_code, fiscal_year = NULL, ...)  agency_budget_functions(   toptier_code,   fiscal_year = NULL,   .page_all = FALSE,   ... )  agency_budget_resources(toptier_code, ...)  agency_obligations_by_award_category(toptier_code, fiscal_year = NULL, ...)

title: Agency Budget Functions and Resources — agency_budget_function_count
text: toptier_code character string containing 3-4 digit numeric code uniquely identifies top-tier federal agency (e.g., "086" Department Housing Urban Development). Must valid CGAC (Common Government-wide Accounting Classification) FREC (Federal Record Classification) code. fiscal_year Optional numeric value specifying fiscal year query. NULL (default), API use current fiscal year. Must 2017 later. ... Additional parameters passed specific API endpoints. Common options include: page: Integer specifying page number retrieve (default: 1) limit: Integer specifying number records per page (default: 10) sort: Field sort results (varies endpoint) order: Sort direction: "asc" "desc" (default varies endpoint) .page_all Logical indicating whether retrieve pages results (TRUE) just first page (FALSE, default). TRUE, function automatically handle pagination retrieve complete dataset.

title: Agency Budget Functions and Resources — agency_budget_function_count
text: function returns tibble different structures: agency_budget_functions() returns: name: Budget function name obligated_amount: Amount obligated gross_outlay_amount: Gross outlay amount children: Nested data frame subfunction details agency_budget_function_count() returns: toptier_code: Agency identifier code fiscal_year: Fiscal year budget_function_count: Number budget functions budget_sub_function_count: Number budget subfunctions agency_budget_resources() returns: fiscal_year: Fiscal year agency_budgetary_resources: Total agency budget agency_total_obligated: Total obligations total_budgetary_resources: Government-wide total budget agency_obligation_by_period: Nested data frame periodic obligations agency_obligations_by_award_category() returns: total_aggregated_amount: Total award obligations results: List obligation amounts award category

title: Agency Budget Functions and Resources — agency_budget_function_count
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Get budget functions for HUD budget_funcs <- agency_budget_functions("086", fiscal_year = 2023)  # Get budget function counts func_counts <- agency_budget_function_count("086", fiscal_year = 2023)  # Get budgetary resources for HUD budget_resources <- agency_budget_resources("086")  # Get obligations by award category award_obligations <- agency_obligations_by_award_category("086", fiscal_year = 2023) }

text: toptier_code character string containing 3-4 digit numeric code uniquely identifies top-tier federal agency (e.g., "086" Department Housing Urban Development). Must valid CGAC (Common Government-wide Accounting Classification) FREC (Federal Record Classification) code. fiscal_year Optional numeric value specifying fiscal year query. NULL (default), API use current fiscal year. Must 2017 later. .page_all Logical indicating whether retrieve pages results (TRUE) just first page (FALSE, default). TRUE, function automatically handle pagination retrieve complete dataset. ... Additional parameters passed specific API endpoints. title: Agency Object Class Information — agency_object_class
text: function returns tibble different structures: agency_object_class() returns: name: Object class name obligated_amount: Amount obligated gross_outlay_amount: Gross outlay amount children: Nested data frame detailed object classes agency_object_class_count() returns: toptier_code: Agency identifier code fiscal_year: Fiscal year object_class_count: Number object classes

title: Agency Object Class Information — agency_object_class
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Get object classes for HUD obj_classes <- agency_object_class("086",                                   fiscal_year = 2023,                                   .page_all = TRUE)  # Get object class counts class_counts <- agency_object_class_count("086", fiscal_year = 2023) }

title: Agency Overview Information — agency_overview
text: Retrieves basic information federal agency including name, abbreviation, mission statement, website, metadata.

title: Agency Overview Information — agency_overview
Agency Overview Information — agency_overview
text: toptier_code character string containing 3-4 digit numeric code uniquely identifies top-tier federal agency (e.g., "086" Department Housing Urban Development). Must valid CGAC (Common Government-wide Accounting Classification) FREC (Federal Record Classification) code. ... Additional parameters passed specific API endpoints. Common options include: page: Integer specifying page number retrieve (default: 1) limit: Integer specifying number records per page (default: 10) sort: Field sort results (varies endpoint) order: Sort direction: "asc" "desc" (default varies endpoint)

title: Agency Overview Information — agency_overview
text: tibble containing agency overview information: fiscal_year: Current fiscal year toptier_code: Agency identifier code name: Full agency name abbreviation: Agency abbreviation agency_id: Numeric agency identifier icon_filename: Agency icon file name mission: Agency mission statement website: Agency website URL congressional_justification_url: URL budget justification about_agency_data: Additional agency information subtier_agency_count: Number sub-agencies

title: Agency Overview Information — agency_overview
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Get overview for Department of Housing and Urban Development hud_overview <- agency_overview("086") }

text: toptier_code character string containing 3-4 digit numeric code uniquely identifies top-tier federal agency (e.g., "086" Department Housing Urban Development). Must valid CGAC (Common Government-wide Accounting Classification) FREC (Federal Record Classification) code. fiscal_year Optional numeric value specifying fiscal year query. NULL (default), API use current fiscal year. Must 2017 later. .page_all Logical indicating whether retrieve pages results (TRUE) just first page (FALSE, default). TRUE, function automatically handle pagination retrieve complete dataset. ... Additional parameters passed specific API endpoints. text: function returns tibble different structures: agency_program_activity() returns: name: Program activity name obligated_amount: Amount obligated gross_outlay_amount: Gross outlay amount agency_program_activity_count() returns: toptier_code: Agency identifier code fiscal_year: Fiscal year program_activity_count: Number program activities

title: Agency Program Activities — agency_program_activity
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Get program activities for HUD programs <- agency_program_activity("086",                                     fiscal_year = 2023,                                    .page_all = TRUE)  # Get program activity counts program_counts <- agency_program_activity_count("086", fiscal_year = 2023) }

title: Agency Sub-Components and Sub-Agencies — agency_sub_agency
text: Functions retrieve information agency sub-components, sub-agencies, organizational structure.

title: Agency Sub-Components and Sub-Agencies — agency_sub_agency
code: agency_sub_agency(toptier_code, fiscal_year = NULL, .page_all = FALSE, ...)  agency_sub_agency_count(   toptier_code,   fiscal_year = NULL,   .page_all = FALSE,   ... )  agency_sub_components(toptier_code, fiscal_year = NULL, ...)  agency_sub_components_accounts(   toptier_code,   bureau_slug,   fiscal_year = NULL,   ... )

title: Agency Sub-Components and Sub-Agencies — agency_sub_agency
text: toptier_code character string containing 3-4 digit numeric code uniquely identifies top-tier federal agency (e.g., "086" Department Housing Urban Development). Must valid CGAC (Common Government-wide Accounting Classification) FREC (Federal Record Classification) code. fiscal_year Optional numeric value specifying fiscal year query. NULL (default), API use current fiscal year. Must 2017 later. .page_all Logical indicating whether retrieve pages results (TRUE) just first page (FALSE, default). TRUE, function automatically handle pagination retrieve complete dataset. ... Additional parameters passed specific API endpoints. Common options include: page: Integer specifying page number retrieve (default: 1) limit: Integer specifying number records per page (default: 10) sort: Field sort results (varies endpoint) order: Sort direction: "asc" "desc" (default varies endpoint) bureau_slug character string representing URL-friendly identifier specific bureau (e.g., "bureau_of_the_census")

title: Agency Sub-Components and Sub-Agencies — agency_sub_agency
text: function returns tibble different structures: agency_sub_components() returns: name: Sub-component name id: Sub-component identifier (bureau_slug) total_budgetary_resources: Total resources total_obligations: Total obligations total_outlays: Total outlays agency_sub_components_accounts() returns: name: Federal account name id: Federal account number total_budgetary_resources: Total resources total_obligations: Total obligations total_outlays: Total outlays agency_sub_agency() returns: name: Sub-agency name abbreviation: Sub-agency abbreviation total_obligations: Total obligations transaction_count: Number transactions new_award_count: Number new awards children: Nested data frame offices agency_sub_agency_count() returns: toptier_code: Agency identifier code fiscal_year: Fiscal year sub_agency_count: Number sub-agencies office_count: Number offices

title: Agency Sub-Components and Sub-Agencies — agency_sub_agency
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Get sub-components for HUD sub_comps <- agency_sub_components("086", fiscal_year = 2023)  # Get federal accounts for a specific bureau bureau_accounts <- agency_sub_components_accounts(   "086",   bureau_slug = "federal_housing_administration",   fiscal_year = 2023 )  # Get sub-agencies sub_agencies <- agency_sub_agency("086", fiscal_year = 2023)  # Get sub-agency counts agency_counts <- agency_sub_agency_count("086", fiscal_year = 2023) }

title: Treasury Account Operations — agency_treasury_account_object_class
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Get object classes for a treasury account tas_objects <- agency_treasury_account_object_class("086-X-0302-000")  # Get program activities for a treasury account tas_programs <- agency_treasury_account_program_activity("086-X-0302-000") }

what: Make a call to the USASpending API — usasp
title: Make a call to the USASpending API — usasp
Make a call to the USASpending API — usasp
Make a call to the USASpending API — usasp
text: endpoint API endpoint call ... Name-value pairs giving API parameters .method HTTP method use ("GET" "POST") .api_url base URL API .api_version API version use .page_all Logical, whether automatically fetch pages .limit Number results per page (max 100) .as_tibble Logical, whether return response tibble .flatten Logical, whether flatten nested structures tibble output

title: Make a call to the USASpending API — usasp
text: Response API, either tibble raw response

title: Make a call to the USASpending API — usasp
code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() # Get single page of results as a tibble usasp("/agency/awards/count", fiscal_year = 2023)  # Get all pages of flattened results usasp("/agency/awards/count", fiscal_year = 2023,        .page_all = TRUE, .flatten = TRUE)        # Send POST request with request body usasp("/search/spending_by_award",       filters = list(         award_type = c("contracts"),         time_period = list(list(           start_date = "2023-01-01",           end_date = "2023-12-31"         ))       ),       fields = c("recipient_name", "total_obligation"),       .method = "POST")        # Get raw JSON response usasp("/agency/awards/count", fiscal_year = 2023, .as_tibble = FALSE) }

what: Common Parameters for USA Spending API Agency Endpoints — usaspending-common-params
title: Common Parameters for USA Spending API Agency Endpoints — usaspending-common-params
text: Documentation common parameters used across USA Spending API agency endpoints

title: Common Parameters for USA Spending API Agency Endpoints — usaspending-common-params
text: toptier_code character string containing 3-4 digit numeric code uniquely identifies top-tier federal agency (e.g., "086" Department Housing Urban Development). Must valid CGAC (Common Government-wide Accounting Classification) FREC (Federal Record Classification) code. fiscal_year Optional numeric value specifying fiscal year query. NULL (default), API use current fiscal year. Must 2017 later. .page_all Logical indicating whether retrieve pages results (TRUE) just first page (FALSE, default). TRUE, function automatically handle pagination retrieve complete dataset. ... Additional parameters passed specific API endpoints. Common options include: page: Integer specifying page number retrieve (default: 1) limit: Integer specifying number records per page (default: 10) sort: Field sort results (varies endpoint) order: Sort direction: "asc" "desc" (default varies endpoint)

title: Interface to USAspending.gov API — usaspending-package
text: Provides comprehensive interface access federal spending data USAspending.gov API (v2). package implements endpoints retrieving data agencies, awards, recipients, reference data, consistent return formats error handling.
